description: The Cattle Tracing System (CTS) is used by the British Cattle Movement Service to record the births, movements and deaths of cattle to help disease control.
title: Cattle Tracing System: cattle births, deaths and movements

department.title: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

transaction.title: Cattle Tracing System: cattle births, deaths and movements

description-extra: The CTS lets users see: details of passport applications and movements; all births, movements and deaths reported in the last 6 months; calving histories for their animals.

modules.title: Transactions per year
info: Data source: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

modules.title: Total cost
info: Data source: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

Total cost is the overall cost per year of providing a service, including staff, IT and accommodation costs; the total cost is automatically calculated from volume and cost per transaction figures, and some rounding errors may occur.

modules.title: Cost per transaction
info: Data source: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
Cost per transaction is the average cost of providing each successfully completed transaction, across all channels. Staff, IT and accommodation costs should be included.

modules.title: Transactions per quarter
modules.description: Total number of transactions each quarter
info: Data source: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

modules.title: Digital take-up
info: Data source: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
Digital take-up measures the percentage of completed applications that are made through a digital channel versus non-digital channels.
